What is a conditional statement, and how does it differ from a disjunction?

A conditional statement connects two statements with "if...then" or "since." It asserts that if one condition is met (antecedent), then another result will follow (consequent). A disjunction is an "or" statement, which asserts that at least one of the options must be true. In this text, the consequent is complex (a disjunctionbut still treated as a conditional.
